author: {'steamid': '76561198038776903', 'num_games_owned': 7260, 'num_reviews': 3814, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1694229118}
review:
宇宙空战飞机。
每次开炮会反作用力往后退。右键是短距离冲刺。
离开屏幕太远会读秒自爆。
按住攻击可以蓄力，但是子弹距离很短。
节奏很快，很容易猝死。
敌人波次递增很快，很有威胁。
不同飞机，似乎只有造型区别。
每次重开一局各种页面动画太多，太慢，没我死的快。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1690172232}
review:
[h1] Довольно невыразительная пиксельная леталка-стрелялка, которая ничем не может удивить и без русского перевода к тому же - страница вводит в заблуждение [/h1]

Настроек тут по минимуму, даже всинка нет - из-за чего процессор жутко напрягается ради 300 кадров. А в остальном просто летаешь стреляешь и потому проигрываешь. Два режима - выживание и мультиплеер. Так что чистейшая аркада на счёт, пока не надоест и небо в алмазах не покажется.

Из недостатков довольно примитивный игровой процесс, примитивный аудиовизуал, нет облачного сохранения и нет русского перевода. В боевых жабах на NES был уровень про астероиды и этот один уровень уделывает всю эту игру.

На линукс через протон экспериментал ситуация с кадрами кстати лучше - чёткие 60 кадров. Хоть комп тоже напрягается - непонятно чему только напрягаться там при такой примитивной графике.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811515990', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1682167069}
review:
Astervoid 2000 is a game that I just had lying around in my Steam library, it looked pretty interesting, and I was also bored so I decided to give it a look. I had no expectations going into it, but I was really not expecting to enjoy it as much as I did, and here's why:

The Gameplay:
The Gameplay seemed pretty simple at first, just shoot and dodge, nothing too interesting, then I found out, there's more to it! You can charge an attack, and it is pretty powerful, but you can also charge it and then use your dodge button for a "melee" attack. But that's not all! There's rocks in the game too! Pretty boring right? Of course... not, there's 3 types of special rocks, there's the 1st one, which is normal rocks, they don't do anything, they could push your enemies farther from you, but we'll get to that part later (there's also another rock that has a different color, but it's basically the same rock); Then there's the Deflective Rock (I made that name up) which from the name, if you shoot into it, the shot will deflect, if you line it up good, you could even hit your enemies; And then there's the Explosive Rock (still made up) if you shoot in this rock for about 4 times it will explode, and if your enemies are close enough to it's radius, they will explode! But hey, that's not it! Remember when I told you that the normal rocks can push enemies? Well occasionally there's gonna be some 'storms', in which a lot of rocks will be coming from a direction, and they can push your enemies! But what does that help me with? Well if they go too far from the screen, they can explode, but be careful, you can get pushed too! Oh and also, if you kill an enemy, they can explode, if another enemy is close to him, the other one can also explode! Oh and sometimes the enemy will be in critical mode, where he doesn't die instantly, but he will not be able to shoot you, they can only get close to you, and after a few seconds, they will explode, that can happen to you too! Also there's 4 player Co-op, and you can play Survival (where you have to kill enemies and... well survive) and Versus (where you have to kill each other).

Graphics
The game is top down, and the graphics are nothing special, but for a game like this, it gets the job done!

Soundtrack
The Soundtrack for most indie games are very good, and obviously this one is very good!

Conclusion
This game caught me by surprise at how fun it is, it's one of those games that you can play once in a while just to kill the time and actually have fun! Although for all the achievement hunters out there, this isn't exactly easy to get it all, and sometimes the game doesn't even count some achievements for some reason.
This game should definitely get more recognition, especially if you are looking for something cheap and fun to play with your friends!

Final Rating: 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1598491895}
review:
"Astervoid 2000" ist ein local-Multiplayer Top-Down Twin-Stick Space-Brawler. 

Mit einer Geschichte hält sich das Game gar nicht erst auf. Wir sehen unser Raumschiff von oben und flegen durch die von Asteroiden verseuchte Gegend. Spielen wir mit dem Controller, fliegen wir mit dem linken Stick, zielen mit dem rechten und haben noch eine Schuß- und eine Boosttaste. Komplexer wird es nicht. Wobei das einfacher klingt als es ist, denn wir fliegen weniger als daß wie gleiten. Zu dieser Trägheit kommt noch ein Rückstoß unserer in der Regel dauerfeuernden Waffen. An dieses System muß man sich ersteinmal ein wenig gewöhnen. Erstaunlicherweise ist durch die Trägheits- und Rückstoßparameter das Spielen und vor allem das Zielen mit Maus und Tastatur präziser als mit dem Controller. 

Unser Schiff wird recht schnell zerstört auch wenn es zumindest ein Schutzschild für den ersten Treffer hat. Neben den Asteroiden schleicht auch immer wieder ein großes, langsames Gegnerschiff durch den Bildschirm, das auf alles schießt, was nach Spieler aussieht und nur durch mehrere Treffer auszuschalten ist. 

Zu Beginn können wir aus mehreren Schiffen und Waffensystemen wählen. Einen erwähnenswerten Einfluß auf das Spiel hat das aber nicht. 
 
Für Single-Player ist das Spiel sicher nichts. Es existiert nur ein Survival-Modus, bei dem man gegen unbalancierte Computergegner möglichst lang überleben muß. Es gibt keinen Fortschritt, keine Geschichte, keinen Grund, das Game länger zu zocken.

Aber dafür ist das Spiel auch nicht gebaut. Das Game ist für den lokalen Multiplayer-Spaß für Zwischendurch gebaut und in diesem Segment (und auch nur in diesem Segment) kann es zumindest eine gewisse Zeit Spaß machen, wenn auch der sehr geringe Content auch in diesem Modus nach kurzer Zeit augescheinlich wird. 

Die Grafik ist simpel, aber passend, Sound und Musik funktionieren, wenn auch nichts davon wirklich in Erinnerung bleiben wird. 

Insgesamt also nur etwas für Leute, die sowohl Freunde als auch mehrere Eingabegeräte ihr eigen nennen. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
5/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass (nur im Multiplayer)

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Multiplayer-Casual Zeitvertreib mit wenig Content.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198013882641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1542002254}
review:
Astervoid 2000 c'est simplement le jeu asteroid, remis un peu au goût du jour graphiquement (mais pas trop) et pourvu d'un mode versus jusqu'à 4 joueurs.

C'est pas forcément mal, mais ça casse pas trois pattes à un canard non plus. Pour une expérience solo y'a largement mieux à faire sur le marché, et si vous prenez ça pour le versus vous aurez vite fait le tour.

Reste que c'est pas trop cher, et qu'en plus il est souvent en promo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313418556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1541886238}
review: le falta mucho para que sea un buen juego, simplemente me gustaria que le añadieran mas modos de juego en el modo multijugador ya que es el modo que mas juego con mis hermanos. aburre un poco al jugar el mismo modo asi que porfavor agreguenle mas modos de juego. el primer modo seria el modo arena, ese modo estaria perfecto en el modo multijugador ya que seria cooperativo, y en las etiquetas de arriba dice cooperativo local pero el juego no tiene nada de cooperativo. el ultimo modo que creo que seria el mejor es el modo batalla contra jefes, ese modo consistiria en que los jugadores lucharian contra naves jigantes hasta llegar al jefe mas fuerte. añadan esos modos y este juego seria perfecto. gracias.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1540878332}
review:
打飞机游戏
基本上的规则就是左键攻击、按住左键可以集气攻击，攻击有很大的作用力，如果不朝着攻击方向移动的话很快就会把自己反出屏幕的（出屏幕一段时间后算在死亡）
飞机外层有个护盾，第一次受到伤害时可用护盾抵消，如果一段时间内没有再受到伤害则会恢复护盾；但如果没有护盾时再次受到伤害就会死亡
并且护盾还能保护你被陨石攻击，有护盾的时候碰撞陨石是没有关系的，但如果没护盾了撞到陨石也是会死亡的
场景中除了敌人外还有各种陨石，有些陨石打爆后会碎成小块，有些能直接炸死附近的单位

两个模式：
单人无尽挑战，杀敌越多分数越高
本地多人对战

总体来说这游戏质量一般，各种飞船除了样子+子弹颜色外本质上没有差别
单人挑战部分也是玩了几次后就没啥太大兴趣了
多人部分说实话类似的游戏很多，比这手感好、玩法多样的游戏还是很多的，而且我是没想明白怎么用一个鼠标控制这么多飞机的瞄准，难道用手柄？这怎么玩？

author: {'steamid': '76561198302554187', 'num_games_owned': 3354, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1535974904}
review:
対戦での逃げ防止なのか、よく判らない範囲外死がヤル気を削ぐ。
てか、ローカル対戦しか出来ないのにこのルールいるか？
操作も色々納得いかない反応が多く、ちまちまあまり大きく動かない様に避けつつ、マウスで狙うだけのゲームとなる。
結果、何も面白くなく、死ぬ時は敵にやられるというよりよく判らず死ぬばっか。

author: {'steamid': '76561198130284480', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1508512098}
review:
Hey! There is a neat game here.

It's a little bit pricey for my liking, this is a throw back to a flash game you might find on the internet.

It played really well and I enjoyed the shooting mechanics. The ships took some getting used to, but once you understood the games physics you could start nailing it.

It's pretty hardcore, the shield is great and puts you on edge when you lose it.

It's a pretty decent game, just too pricey. 

It's a lot better than a great number of other games I've been playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198209676208', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1507122913}
review:
[b]■俺評価(10段階)[/b]
総合評価 ・・・・・・・3 ☆☆☆ まあまあ
このゲームは買い？ ・・安ければ
サンドボックス化 ・・・〇

[b]■英語が判らない・英語だと辛い前提の評価[/b]
日本語化・・未対応だが、日本語化不要で遊べる。
UI・・・・・未対応だが、直感で操作できる。
字幕・・・・無し

[b]■操作感・グラフィックス[/b]
キーボード＋マウス ・〇
ゲームパッド ・・・・◎
グラフィックス ・・・レトロチックなドット絵

[b]■不具合(気が付いた事)[/b]
特になし

[b]■ゲーム評価[/b]
人間 vs AIの対戦シューティング。
ゲームパッド推薦。操作に慣れが必要か。
アクション苦手だと、即アンインストール対象。
ブーストと移動が思うように動かない。
何故か画面外に出やすい。
画面外に出ると復帰する事がとても難しい。
AIがバカなのか、お利口なのか判断し辛い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1501968811}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991179373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1529920518}
review: Awesome local multiplayer party game!  Up to 4 players can blast each other in this game that borrows a little bit from the arcade classic Asteroids but has a lot more to offer with its various power-ups.  The graphics are very well done but the system requirements are still relatively low so it should work well on a variety of machines.  If you like top down shooters and want to share the fun with friends, this is a great title to pick up and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966527290', 'num_games_owned': 3794, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1498517000}
review:
"Jouable jusqu’à quatre joueurs, ce petit titre propose des affrontements dans l’espace, en une 2D assez sympathique. De jolis pixels proposent donc des bastons à base de projectiles qui, lancés, repoussent notre vaisseau vers l’arrière pour empêcher le matraquage sans conséquences. Si vous sortez de l’écran, volontairement ou à cause de ce recul, vous risque d’être disqualifié.

Cela fonctionne très bien et Astervoid 2000 réussi à proposer à la fois du jeu local de qualité, vraiment intense et proposant une vraie évolution dans la maitrise de son vaisseau, mais aussi une partie Solo en survie avec du classement mondial à la clé. Pour égayer les parties, plusieurs types d’évènements viendront ennuyer le(s) joueur(s) : des météores qui renvoient les projectiles, des bombes, des vaisseaux aliens qui vous tirent dessus… Ce n’est pas un grand jeu, mais il fonctionne très bien une fois réunis sur un canapé."

Vous pouvez lire davantage d'articles sur Http://www.gamesidestory.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198088525351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1488742536}
review: Retro awesomeness! I'm loving this game. There's a surprising amount of gameplay depth under a simple guise. It's fast. It's unforgiving. Looking to take that Survival Mode record. Look out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041145502', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1479866356}
review: It's a pretty fun game to pick up and play for a while. It gets much better with friends when you play local multiplayer. It's too bad there is no online multiplayer but Astervoid is still a pretty good choice for some arcade action. The graphics are pretty solid but the particle effects (things like lasers and explosions) are fantastic looking. The electronic-themed soundtrack provides the perfect  backdrop for blasting enemies. If you want an oldschool aracde experience similar to classics like Galaga and Asteroid but with fancier graphics, Astervoid2000 is the droid you've been looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050472614', 'num_games_owned': 1286, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1704376469}
review:
[h1] Обзор Linux / SteamOS версии игры [/h1]

Astervoid 2000 это эдакий старый добрый аркадный астероид  приправленый современными графическими эффектами, локальным мультиплеером на 4х человек (режим deathmatch) и своими особенностями управления и инерцией в космосе. Игра очень актуальна в компании из 4х человек. Режим на одного игрока лишь один и это "Выживание", волны врагов увеличиваются и мы пытаемся выжить и набрать как можно больше очков за убийства (присутствует сетевой список лидеров)
Ачивки присутствуют, карточки есть также.
Классные саундтреки.

Русского языка нет, сетевого мультиплеера нет.
Цена на момент написания завышена.
Игралось всё на Kubuntu 16.04 + ноутбуке (i3 2310m + nvidia 540M+ 8Gb RAM). Стабильно игралось вылетов не было, но периодиски при большом количестве эффектов взрывов проседал FPS довольно таки прилично.

К покупке рекомендую только в том случае: 
--Если у вас гости из 4х человек + 4 джойстика + здоровый телевизор/монитор.
--Если цену сбросили.
--Если вы любитель олдскульно-пиксельного инди добра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215233645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1481165788}
review:
Read Full Review Here: http://pewpewcat.com/astervoid-2000-indie-game-review/

Astervoid 2000 reminded me of the good old days when I used to play Asteroids on either the super old computer we had at the time or at the arcade. Astervoid 2000 is kind of like that. However, everything is pixel art instead of being old school, white wired frame-like. On top of that, you don’t have to leave the comfort of your own home to play it.

Astervoid 2000 has two options of how to play. Either you can play single player or vs up to four people. From there, you try to shoot the enemy ships before they shoot you. Along the way, you have to dodge obstacles like flying asteroids that will push you off of the screen. If you’re off the screen too long, you blow up. Also, there’s no screen wrapping in this game.

I really like the art in this game, and how some of the ships looked like a squid or a crab. That’s the only reason why I chose those ships to use. Plus, after you get the hang of it, it becomes a tad bit addicting. I made it to #36 on the leader boards.

It’s a modern spin to a classic, and reminds me of the good old days. It’s great for parties!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083035634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1482722628}
review:
The single player mode is really challenging, which is great because you can have a really quick session and don't have to coast through waves of too easy enemies.  The controls are fantastic, responsive, and easy to learn.  The game really shines in the couch multiplayer mode.  Matches last a few minutes and are really intense.  Music is great too.

It's a very polished game and exactly what it says it is and needs to be.  It's a great next step in the evolution of games like Asteroids and Spacewar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025003435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1480917491}
review: Nice! Fast paced and sweet soundtrack. Great game for parties with 4 player local multiplayer. The best thing is how well the controls are tuned, there's lots of couch multiplayer type games out there but Astervoid's controls are what make it stand out. Every detail feels just right, even down to the pushback from firing a charged shot. Love it! Great work!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963895278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1480878105}
review:
I do know the devs of Astervoid 2000, and have played it in various states over the last few years, but I will attempt to review the game, as it is, as honestly as possible. Here's a spoiler though. I think it is very good.
Fast, snappy dual joystick control and clean mechanics. Feels similar to TowerFall or Smash Bros., where it's not so much variety of moves or abilities, but how you can use the simple tools made available to you in Astervoid 2000 that make it a fun pick up and play game for a group of friends. 
The Single player wave mode is very entertaining for a few minutes at a time, and it's the sort of thing I can see myself coming back to in fits and starts for a long while to come. 
Everything included, music, graphics, mechanics, is polished to a high shine, but there might not be enough there to keep anything less than a group of 3 or 4 engaged for a long time. The addition of some extra layers to the game, new modes, new weapons, abilities, etc. would probably cement Astervoid 2000s place as a couch classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057557525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1480647126}
review:
10/10 would sail off edge of map into the dark void of space again, shedding a single tear while dying alone and friendless.

-- awesome retro pixel art/glorious explosions
-- a tribute to asteroids. but much much prettier
-- cracking chippy soundtrack
-- tight controls once you get used to them
-- purely skill-based, no buying your way to inglorious victory!
-- doesn't baby you with unnecessary tutorials, you can drop right into a game without preamble
-- blast your friends into oblivion
-- die alone and friendless again
-- find new friends
-- repeat

what's that? already bleachmurdered all your friends in dayZ? fear not, for there is a singleplayer mode and it is fearsomely addictive, particularly if like me you have run out of people to torment during your lunch hour at work. 

wishlist: online multiplayer so I can run out of friends in other countries.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025723082', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1480655853}
review:
If I could leave stars, I'd give this one 10 out of 10.  It perfectly captures the atmosphere it intended, soundtrack rocks, and the controls are fluid and smooth.  

It adds special nostalgia for me as I used to play titles like this with my roomates in my early years.

The hard part with a game like this, is the screenshots really don't do it justice.  I loved the animation and effects throughout, and felt it perfectly captured that old school feel while giving it a nice upgrade "in the right places".  The sound and music match and feel right to me.

Note:  Still playing so will com eback and update

author: {'steamid': '76561197968517071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1480836800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010932791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1480619343}
review: I'd call Astervoid 2000 a fast-paced couch multiplayer arena shooter with an impeccable sense of style. Right from the start screen the music and visuals combine to grip the player with an acid-retro aesthetic in the same vein as Hotline Miami. The game rewards skillful maneuvering with the space-warping explosions of your opponents. A clever Kamikaze mechanic can provide some exhilerating moments with your friends as your final breath takes your attacker with you to the void. An obligatory Survival Mode gives you a space to practice alone before your next multiplayer gaming session.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963282239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1515475480}
review:
Awesome couch-multiplayer game. It's one of those games where you start out high-fiving your buddies but by the end you're punching each other, or at least everyones punching Jeff because that guy can't ever freakin lose. Screw you Jeff. 

Before purchasing I had only played it at various events so this was the first time for me playing single player, which is a great addition. The 'horde mode' style single-player brings me back to my days in the arcade chasing the top high score, and the use of the keyboard and mouse is great (I might even prefer it to a controller, surprisingly).

I know the devs of this game (bought the game though, did not receive it free), and regardless this game is worth picking up whether you are in it for the classic arcade-ness of the single player, or just really good couch-muliplayer fun. Not to mention how incredible the soundtrack is too! Seriously go play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198276005287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1480616835}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022299326', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1480615551}
review: I've seen this game grow from attending different game conferences over the years and it's great to see it end up as a cohesive and energetic game. The single player is pretty good but really this game is meant for local multiplayer as that's where it shines. The soundtrack also kicks ass.
